segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 2
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 2

segments.pli: 16. Kodhapeyyāla
segments.en: 16. Abbreviated Texts Beginning with Anger

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā.
segments.en: “There are these two things.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Kodho ca upanāho ca … makkho ca paḷāso ca … issā ca macchariyañca … māyā ca sāṭheyyañca … ahirikañca anottappañca.
segments.en: Anger and hostility … offensiveness and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā”.
segments.en: These are the two things.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā.
segments.en: “There are these two things.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Akkodho ca anupanāho ca … amakkho ca apaḷāso ca … anissā ca amacchariyañca … amāyā ca asāṭheyyañca … hirī ca ottappañca.
segments.en: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from offensiveness and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā”.
segments.en: These are the two things.”

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato dukkhaṃ viharati.
segments.en: “Anyone who has two things lives in suffering.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
segments.en: Anger and hostility … offensiveness and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato dukkhaṃ viharati”.
segments.en: Anyone who has these two things lives in suffering.”

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato sukhaṃ viharati.
segments.en: “Anyone who has these two things lives happily.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
segments.en: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from offensiveness and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato sukhaṃ viharati”.
segments.en: Anyone who has these two things lives happily.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Kodho ca upanāho ca … makkho ca paḷāso ca … issā ca macchariyañca … māyā ca sāṭheyyañca … ahirikañca anottappañca.
segments.en: Anger and hostility … offensiveness and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti”.
segments.en: These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Akkodho ca anupanāho ca … amakkho ca apaḷāso ca … anissā ca amacchariyañca … amāyā ca asāṭheyyañca … hirī ca ottappañca.
segments.en: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from offensiveness and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti”.
segments.en: These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
segments.en: “Anyone who has two things is cast down to hell.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
segments.en: Anger and hostility … offensiveness and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye”.
segments.en: Anyone who has these two things is cast down to hell.”

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
segments.en: “Anyone who has two things is raised up to heaven.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
segments.en: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from offensiveness and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”.
segments.en: Anyone who has these two things is raised up to heaven.”

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: “When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
segments.en: Anger and hostility … offensiveness and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati”.
segments.en: When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: “When they have two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Katamehi dvīhi?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
segments.en: Freedom from anger and hostility … freedom from offensiveness and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati”.
segments.en: When they have these two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Kodhapeyyālaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
